javadoc:
Interface for reporting the FieldViewer selection.  The selection consists of
 a sequence of ranges of indexes.

methods.javadoc:
Construct a new FieldSelection with the same selection as the given FieldSelection.
@param selection the FieldSelection to copy.
methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Construct a new FieldSelection with the same selection as the given FieldSelection.

methods.javadoc: Removes all indexes from the list.
methods.name: clear
methods.comment: Removes all indexes from the list.

methods.name: contains
methods.comment: Returns true if the given Field at the given index is in the selection.

methods.name: getRangeContaining
methods.comment:
Returns the range if the given Field at the given index is in the selection.
 Otherwise returns null.

methods.name: containsEntirely
methods.comment:
Returns true if the all the fields in the layout with the given index are
  included in this selection.

params.name: index
params.comment: index of the layout to test.

methods.name: addRange
methods.comment: Adds a field range to this selection.

methods.name: addRange
methods.comment:
Add the all the indexes from startIndex to endIndex to the selection.  The added
 range includes the startIndex, but not the endIndex.

params.name: startIndex
params.comment: the start index of the layouts to include

params.name: endIndex
params.comment: the end index(not inclusive) of the layouts to include

methods.name: removeRange
methods.comment: Removes the given field range from the current selection.

methods.name: removeRange
methods.comment: Removes the all the fields in the index range from the selection.

params.name: startIndex
params.comment: the first index in the range to remove.

params.name: endIndex
params.comment: the last index in the range to remove.

methods.javadoc: Returns the current number of ranges in the list.
methods.name: getNumRanges
methods.comment: Returns the current number of ranges in the list.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the i'th Field Range in the selection.
@param rangeNum the index of the range to retrieve.
methods.name: getFieldRange
methods.comment: Returns the i'th Field Range in the selection.

params.name: rangeNum
params.comment: the index of the range to retrieve.

methods.javadoc:
Compute the intersection of this field selection and another one. The intersection of two field selections is all fields existing in both selections.

Note: This field selection becomes the intersection. @param selection field selection to intersect.
methods.name: intersect
methods.comment:
Compute the intersection of this field selection and another one.
 The intersection of two field selections is all fields existing in 
 both selections.
 Note: This field selection becomes the intersection.

methods.javadoc:
Computes the intersection of this field selection and the given field selection.
@param selection the selection to intersect with.
methods.name: findIntersection
methods.comment: Computes the intersection of this field selection and the given field selection.

methods.name: delete
methods.comment: Delete all fields in the ranges in the given field selection from this one.

params.name: selection
params.comment:
the field selection fields to remove from this 
 field selection.

methods.name: insert
methods.comment: Insert all fields in the ranges in the given field selection from this one.

params.name: selection
params.comment:
the field selection fields to add to this 
 field selection.

methods.javadoc: Prints out the ranges for debugging.
methods.name: printRanges
methods.comment: Prints out the ranges for debugging.

name: FieldSelection
comment:
Interface for reporting the FieldViewer selection.  The selection consists of
 a sequence of ranges of indexes.
